title: Evolved Claws Has Zero Evolutionary Benefit Unless Isolated (Kha'Zix)

embed.description: Break out the nerf guns and buff pads: it's time for another round of the Patch Preview. Click here to sign up and play League of Legends for free: http://bit.ly/100m14U

body:
It's readily known that Kha'Zix is on the weak side right now and I am of the opinion that in order to make Kha'Zix a more reliable and effective champion pick, and to be more than just a jungler, two simple things need to happen:

- Turrets no longer count as allies for the sake of negating his isolation benefits
~ Recall the saying, "You are there to protect the turret, it is not there to protect you." As it stands, Kha'Zix is currently being punished by a change that was put into place long ago before all of the sweeping turret changes of patch 4.20. The towers were changed so why didn't Kha'Zix?
- Evolved Claws now again deals  % missing health damage, regardless as to whether or not the target is isolated. 
~ In the patch preview for 3.8, FeralPony says the following, "The problem with Taste Their Fear was that all of its evolutionary damage was based on your target being isolated and low on health but you got nothing if they weren't. We still want to reward you for catching isolated targets but we didn't want the evolution to rely on it so completely." Well fast forward to today and Taste Their Fear has gone full circle, being completely useless when evolved unless the target is completely isolated and with the nerfs to the range necessary to actually isolate a target, one might say this ability is even worse than when it started.

replies.body:
Riot walks a fine line with Kha'Zix's evolutions. They want all of the evolutions to be viable, but not completely necessary to his kit or burst pattern. Essentially, they're bonuses that support your Kha'Zix playstyle, without there being a set 'best' evolution. Currently, they're failing at that, but it's a hard problem to solve.

Hard, but not impossible. These are my suggestions.

Buff Taste Their Fear. The current evolve bonus should be baseline. Kha'Zix's theme is isolation? Reinforce it without requiring you evolve his claws. Evolving the claws grants the increased range, and bonus damage. This damage can be whatever. It can be execution based, it can ignore a portion of the target's armor, it could apply Unseen Threat on hit, whatever. But it adds to the isolation burst while also adding damage when the target isn't isolated.

Void Spikes is fine, but weird. I think it should be buffed to always fire three lines of spikes. Maybe nerf the slow to compensate. Evolving Void Spikes would be Evolve Venom Sacs, which makes the Void Spikes envenom the target with a psychotic void toxin, making them feel paranoid and _isolated_. This evolution would give Kha'Zix more reliability late game, but good players could function without it. It's a bonus.

Leap should have it's range slightly buffed, maybe halfway between current unevolved and evolved, and have the damage nerfed. Evolving Wings would buff the range, make the damage true damage instead of physical, and allow the Leap resets. It promotes the playstyle of, get in, kill, get out.

His ultimate is really good the way it is. Evolving it should promote a stealthy playstyle for sneaky Kha's that want to subvert wards. Evolve Active Camouflage no longer allows a third cast - That promotes more of a duelist playstyle where the Kha'Zix has extended, one on one fights where he benefits from Unseen Threat multiple times. Make it so that, if Kha'Zix is moving towards a bush, the stealth duration is increased infinity until he either moves in a different direction, or reaches a bush. This makes Kha'Zix a sneaky one who can subvert wards by ulting towards a bush. Even if the bush is warded, he won't be spotted until he's in it already. And then he can cast Void Assault a second time for the ambush.

Just my ideas.

I like most of this, but the issue I see is that he still lacks the amount of reliability that every other AD assassin has. Hitting someone with W shouldn't make them isolated. The problem is the lack of counterplay that results from that situation.

Instead of making them instantly isolated, what if hitting a champion with void spikes decreased the isolation radius by 100-150? That gives it counterplay by still sticking with your team, but also opens more windows for playmaking.

Additionally, I think isolation Q should be calculated on cast, not on hit. If this were the case, you would know for sure when you were getting isolation damage, as opposed to the BS where you hit them while they flash into their team and you do like 1/3 the damage you thought you would. That would make it easier to actually calculate whether you can get the reset or not.

As for the evolved ultimate, I think that's a good start, but it's still not worth evolving it. The evolved R is tricky because you want the evolution to actually enhance his stealth gameplay, but if you choose the stealth over another ability, it doesn't actually give you any snowball potential. 

With only 3 evolutions in a normal game, the easiest evolution to drop given your solution is and always will be evolved R. It just doesn't help the kit. Q damage is necessary. W's easier isolation is incredibly valuable. E's resets are a necessity. Being invisible for longer is not important compared to those abilities. It just isn't. No matter what, you can always do without. Either through increased vision control and sweepers, or outplaying the opponent, you just don't need it. Here's what I'm thinking:

Evolved R: Gives increased movement speed of 80% instead of 40%, and bonus % AD per rank of R of 4/8/12%. If not bonus AD, maybe damage amplification against the first champion he attacks out of stealth of a similar value. For me, that makes it actually worth something. It promotes him as a stealthy killer, and it might actually be worth getting instead of one of the other evolved abilities. It forces the choice. Do I get easier isolation? Do I get moar damages? Do I get reliable stealth with damage for ganks and assassination ability? Do I get the invaluable reset? That's actually a tough enough choice that wouldn't always follow the same evolution cycle every game.
HELL YES on your evolved void spike idea

It's Riot balance team's logic at his finest.

On release it only affected isolated targets. Then they changed it to affect all enemies with greater effect on isolated ones, specifically stating that it was because isolated-only evolution bonus is too situational...

...then they reverted it to work only on isolated targets AFTER making isolation much harder to achieve.
Maybe they hire a new balance team every patch?

I've faced awesome kha'zix about a motnh ago.. He was trashing our team like we were made out of paper...
But yeah skill gap between bad-good-awesome Kha players is too huge considering that for example Nidalee has by far stronger finisher in her cat from, than Kha with his isolated target

Kha'zix is still incredibly strong after a snowball. The problem is that instead of requiring him to have good positioning, he requires the enemy to have BAD positioning. It's the opposite of what makes sense. Normal champions have the ability to actually outplay an opponent by forcing them into a mistake, or just  being stronger. Kha'zix has to actively wait for them to fuck up before he can take advantage of it. Even if the window opens up, because  isolation is so large, it's not hard for them to completely fix the positioning while you engage, leaving you a sitting duck.

Lol you think Riot cares about us Kha'Zix players.

We aren't Lee Sin or Nidalee. They don't give a crap if our champion is a pathetic husk of what his design is supposed to be.
You are wrong my friend. I'd have a look at this.http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/0o9f7Ebu-riot-meddler-would-like-some-red-opinionsdiscussion-on-khazix?comment=0000

Oh, I'm aware they *know* he's too weak, I just think they don't *care*. You'll note Meddler says he doesn't know an ETA and they're "planning to look at, see *if* there's potential buffs they can give him."

That not only puts them even *examining* him up in the air, but the idea of buffs once/if they do look at him up in the air as well.

Riot is actually fairly aware of balance-states of champions. It all comes down to what champions they like and what champions they don't, and that's a fact they've proven over and over and over and over during the last 4 seasons. They don't like Kha'zix much (if essentially reworking him through sheer number of nerfs is any indicator). Therefore, even if he *does* get buffs, they probably will have very, very little impact, so they can say "yeah we buffed him so he's fine now" even if he's still in a really crappy state afterwards.

Not to mention, they have little-to-no respect whatsoever for preserving a champion's design and character vision. The Casseiopeia fiasco, which Cass mains (at least, every one I know and every one I see on the forums) are *still* feeling completely shit on by Riot about, is evidence of this. They don't care about the preserving the *character* and design direction of the champion, they just care about the champion's balance state. It doesn't help any that despite Kha'Zix players being able and willing to provide every possible suggestion and bit of feedback Riot needs about the champion, Riot still refuses to respect the champion or listen to his players (remember how Bruiser Kha'zix happened?). 

I apologize for the salt, I'm just *still* incredibly infuriated by how ridiculously they handled the champion and where they left him. They learned absolutely nothing from how they handled Shaco years ago: Dumpster the assassin, force a completely different playstyle, then leave them in obscurity.

tbh I just want the execute back. I've played Kha'Zix since I started playing this game last January when he was pretty much broken. He's the reason I jungle now and I'd like to think that I wouldn't even play this game, or at least buy RP, if it weren't for the fact that I loved playing this champion. The 4.10 patch ruined his gameplay for awhile. Then he got 10 damage, only to get his w nerfed.

The biggest problem I ever had was the isolation to towers. I always thought it was so stupid. If someone was under tower it meant they went from nearly dying instantly to you shooting them with a marshmallow gun.

He'd be fine if they either made it to where towers didn't unisolate targets again or if he got the execute back on evolved Q. Until then he will remain a sub-par jungler and poor laner.

> [He'd be fine] if they either made it to where towers didn't unisolate targets again or if he got the execute back on evolved Q. Until then he will remain a sub-par jungler and poor laner.

I don't necessarily agree with that statement. By all means, let him have his execute back, but if they restore his ability to delete targets who are recalling under turret without minions nearby (and let's be honest: if you're recalling under your turret in the first place, that's probably not the case), then Bruiser Kha'Zix (which Riot tried very hard to get rid of) will return, regardless of the fact that his ultimate doesn't reduce incoming damage anymore, simply because they will want that extra tankiness to survive diving turrets and taking out those high-value, low risk targets.

Now, the reason(s) Kha'Zix does so bad in the jungle right now are two-fold; the first reason being the one everybody complains about: he's just too damn squishy, and has no sustain unless he maxes W (or builds AP, but that'll get you reported for trolling for sure.)

The second reason is, quite simply, that most people still try to build and play him bruiser-style, even though Riot went to great lengths to ensure that wasn't possible. (Keep in mind that Bruiser Kha'Zix is the whole reason they nerfed him so hard; they saw an assassin being played in an unhealthy manner that allowed very little counter-play, so they removed everything that made it possible, and then some.)

I'm a huge Kha'Zix fan. I saw him a while ago, back at level 10 or so, and he was the first 6300 champion I ever bought. I learned how to jungle on Kha'Zix, and I still play him now. 

Currently, I feel he is rather weak in the jungle. His sustain is rather bad due to the heal being a AP ration with a 10 second CD, and his Q does very little unless you kill the smaller minions first (which results in a ton of damage taken) or finish Hydra. If you catch someone out with your Q evolved, they will usually die. The damage is insane, [I played a game where I went 25/1](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1773842126/209417324?tab=overview) and I was at the point where could jump on an isolated target, Q then Hydra for the instant kill. However, as fed as I was, I could not solo the enemy Nasus if he had so much as a minion near him. He was actually the person who killed me once. 

My big thing, is he needs the % missing health damage back, but only on evolved Q without requiring the target to be isolated. It would give Kha'Zix a way to do damage to targets other than people who positioned poorly. I hate ganking bot lane with him, as the support and ADC are usually smart enough to stick together when I show up.

P.S. In regards to my build that game, I don't usually build BT but my jungle item would go there. I built it last because I was super fed, the life-steal was for soloing Baron, and the 80 damage was nice.

I'd be fine if they'd just remove the ability to avoid isolation by being around minions, that to me was going completely overboard, turrets, I can understand, but minions?

They are of limited help as is anyways. Hydra baybe

I don't know why it counts as an entity to prevent isolation other than the fact it probably has some strange code, like those weird siege creeps in DotA2 (fun fact: In DotA2, if you attack a siege creep with a single creep or hero standing next to it, it will take isolation damage from Spectre's isolation true damage on-hit effect. However, if the siege creep is completely alone, it will not take the isolation damage.)
Nope they actually deliberately added it as a nerf to Kha'Zix tower diving or to increase your protection from Kha'Zix under turret or something like that

In my opinion, What kha needs is a means to create isolation for himself, instead of relying on your enemy to be foolish enough to isolate themselves. W should provide a knock to the side for any minions/champions in the vicinity of the target (or vice versa; you knock the champion you hit away). This would allow you to hit a skill shot that could provide you with the means to properly deal isolated damage.

Evolved Q:
Isolation is now what it was prenerf (aka need to be closer and towers dont count)

He's in a really good spot lategame, but his early game is absolute shit, and ganks don't do much until 6.
